item.title: Deep and wide pothole, 9th December
item.description:
This pothole is in the carpark of The Green shops, in Bishops Drive. It’s almost impossible to avoid and could do significant damage to a tyre
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishops Drive, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request to cut tree roots and also highlighting damage to pavement, 9th December
item.description:
Good afternoon, I have been directed to your department by Chris Chavasse at Cheltenham Council with regard to the tree outside our house in Leckhampton. Please find below photos of the tree, its location to our house, the one with the red door, and the roots showing in our front ‘garden’. There is also cracking under our pathway, which may or may not be as a result of the another root. We would guess the distance from the tree to the further evidence of roots is somewhere between 5-10 metres, although there is obvious root damage to the pavement as seen in the photos, which may be something for you to look at as well? We would like to do some works to this area in front of the house and would be grateful if you would please advise whether we can cut these roots out? We look forward to hearing from you. Robin Bygrave

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Naunton Park Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath completely unusable, 9th December
item.description:
Fields have been ploughed and all of footpath is completely destroyed and unusable. Gates to enter between fields have also been blocked. Was the same situation as when I visited here last year but gave it benefit of the doubt initially.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golden Valley Junction, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ash tree half fallen on the bank very close to the road, 9th December
item.description:
By the side of the road, right hand side between Whittington and Whalley Farm, just beyond Marlands. Tree half down in the storm, leaning dangerously. One tree down on Sunday morning but has been cleared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Fallen over public footpath bridge, 9th December
item.description:
Due to the heavy storms last weekend a large Willow Tree has split down its trunk and has fallen (in part) over a public footpath bridge. The tree appears stable due to numerous branches wedged on the ground and the bridge, but it could fall over if strong winds return. The base of the trunk and roots are also on an island so a specialist maybe required to access the tree in a safe manner
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
